content: Aske Mottelson - IT-University of Copenhagen Aske Mottelson offentligt CV Aske Mottelson PhD, MSc Associate Professor, Human-Computer Interaction and DesignPattern Recognition Revisited labHead of Programme, BSc in Digital Design and Interactive Technologies https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1827-8513 Emailasmoitudk 4E, RLVDenmark 20162025 Research activity per year Personal profile Current positionAssociate Professor, Human-Centered Data Science, IT University of CopenhagenResearch areasI’m a computer scientist with research interests in human-computer interaction, psychology, and data science. My research is about understanding user behavior of computer systems, and what this tells us about human psychology. My work entails designing and conducting computerized experiments with human participants, and modeling the interactions using statistical and machine learning techniques. I’m studying, and ultimately aiming at improving, how to conduct empirical research in computer science. I utilize a range of technologies such as extended reality and mobile interfaces to evaluate, understand, and improve the study of interactions between humans and computers at scale.
